title: Jabdighat Bridge Corruption Case
description:
The Jabdighat Bridge Corruption Case involves the construction of a substandard bridge over the Babai River in Bardiya district, which collapsed in August 2017 before its official handover to the government. The bridge was a critical infrastructure project intended to connect Gulariya, the district headquarters, with Barbardiya Municipality.

The primary contractor, Pappu Construction Pvt. Ltd., owned by then-lawmaker Harinarayan Prasad Sah Rauniyar and his son Sumit Rauniyar, was accused of gross negligence, using substandard materials, and deviating from the approved engineering design. An investigation by the Commission for the Investigation of Abuse of Authority (CIAA) revealed that the bridge's piles were not built to the required depth, leading to its structural failure during floods.

The CIAA also implicated several officials from the Division Road Office, Nepalgunj, alleging they colluded with the contractor by approving the flawed construction and releasing payments without conducting proper quality checks. In October 2018, the CIAA filed a corruption case at the Special Court against 12 individuals, including the Rauniyars, government engineers, and a consultant.

Key outcomes of the case include:

  • Harinarayan Rauniyar's automatic suspension from his post as a Member of Parliament upon the filing of the corruption case.
  • In May 2022, the Special Court found the Rauniyars and several government officials guilty. The court imposed significant fines on the father-son duo and handed down prison sentences and fines to a number of the accused officials.
  • Several accused individuals were acquitted by the Special Court.
  • The defendants have since appealed the verdict at the Supreme Court, where the case is currently pending.

As of late 2023, the bridge has not been reconstructed, causing significant hardship for local residents who are forced to use boats or temporary crossings to access essential services.
unverified_info:
There are several discrepancies in the financial figures reported across different sources. This information requires further verification.

  • Initial Contract Value: Sources cite varying amounts for the contract, including Rs 166.8 million, Rs 190.75 million, and Rs 165 million.
  • Amount Claimed by CIAA: The amount the CIAA sought to recover from the accused also varies in reports. Figures include Rs 193,225,695 each from Harinarayan and Sumit Rauniyar (totaling over Rs 380 million), and a separate figure of Rs 190.32 million from Harinarayan Rauniyar.
  • Special Court Fine: There is conflicting information regarding the fine imposed on the Rauniyars by the Special Court on May 8, 2022. One source states the fine was Rs 72.40 million combined, while another indicates it was Rs 37.2 million.
key_allegations: Use of substandard construction materials and deviation from approved design.
Collusion between the contractor and government officials to approve flawed work and release payments.
Negligence leading to the structural failure and collapse of the bridge before its official handover.
Embezzlement of funds allocated for the bridge construction.
related_entities: Commission for the Investigation of Abuse of Authority (CIAA)

timeline.title: Construction Contract Signed
timeline.description: The contract for the construction of the Jabdighat bridge was signed between the Division Road Office, Nepalgunj, and Pappu Construction Pvt. Ltd.

timeline.title: Bridge Collapses
timeline.description: The newly constructed bridge over the Babai River at Jabdighat collapsed during heavy floods in August 2017, before it could be formally handed over to the government.

timeline.title: CIAA Files Corruption Case
timeline.description: The CIAA filed a corruption case at the Special Court against 12 individuals, including Harinarayan Rauniyar, his son Sumit, and 10 government officials and consultants, for their involvement in the substandard construction.

timeline.title: Pappu Construction Owners Released on Bail
timeline.description: Harinarayan Rauniyar and his son Sumit Rauniyar were released from custody after each posted a bail of Rs 17.5 million (1.75 crores).

timeline.title: Permission Granted for Repair
timeline.description: The Division Road Office in Nepalgunj granted permission to Pappu Construction to repair the damaged bridge at its own cost, despite the ongoing corruption case.

timeline.title: Special Court Convicts Accused
timeline.description: The Special Court found Harinarayan Rauniyar, Sumit Rauniyar, and several government officials guilty of corruption. Fines were imposed on the Rauniyars, and prison sentences and fines were handed to officials. Four of the accused were acquitted.

timeline.title: MP Begins Hunger Strike for Reconstruction
timeline.description: Sanjay Gautam, a federal parliament member from Bardiya, began a fast-unto-death strike under the ruins of the collapsed bridge, demanding its immediate reconstruction.

timeline.title: Case Pending at Supreme Court
timeline.description: Reports confirm that the defendants have appealed the Special Court's verdict at the Supreme Court, where the case remains pending. The bridge has not been repaired.
